nodes.bodyText:
Is this reformatting done by purpose? Sometimes this can happen because some setting in the editor gets change by misstake.
If you want the formatting this way, I will not argue against it. But I don't think this is how JMRI usually format switch case statements.
That's the way my IDE does it, but it also looks like the  standard format.   It's only a spacing issue with the reformatting.
Now I see that the case statements are no longer indented.  Not sure why, in the past using the same IDE, it has been.  Something has changed, but not by me.
Found and fixed the formatting issue with my IDE. Thanks for bring it to my attention.
